title: How to Make a Clementine Candle

steps.headline: Cut one orange in half.
steps.description:
Only cut through the skin though, not through the flesh. Make a thin slice directly in the middle of the orange to create the guide. Run your knife over the thin slice to create a deeper slice until you’ve reached the fruit. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Ease your thumb underneath the skin so your thumb is wedged between the fruit and the skin.
Grasp the meaty middle section of the other orange half (the half that does not contain the die cut star).
steps.description: Twist upward. You will be creating a “wick” from the orange skin so you want the skin to protrude upward as much as possible. Pinch end together once you have enough meat.

steps.headline: Fill the same half of the empty orange (the half that does not contain the die cut star) with olive oil.
steps.description:
Slowly and carefully fill the half only ¼ to ½ way. Do not cover the top of the orange wick. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Light the wick with a match and hold for several seconds until the fire “takes.”
Place the star cut top half of the orange on top of the lit half for a unique and alluring “candle.”

text:
Preparing the Orange Cut one orange in half. Only cut through the skin though, not through the flesh. Make a thin slice directly in the middle of the orange to create the guide. Run your knife over the thin slice to create a deeper slice until you’ve reached the fruit. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Ease your thumb underneath the skin so your thumb is wedged between the fruit and the skin. Slide your thumb gently back and forth to release the skin from the fruit without disturbing the skin or tearing it. Run your thumb underneath and along the entire cut area to loosen the skin from the fruit. Use fingers if you find that method to be easier. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Travel upward, toward the bottom/top of the fruit until you’ve released the fruit from the skin without breaking the skin. Perform this step on both halves of the orange. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Lighting and Using the Candle Grasp the meaty middle section of the other orange half (the half that does not contain the die cut star). Twist upward. You will be creating a “wick” from the orange skin so you want the skin to protrude upward as much as possible. Pinch end together once you have enough meat. Fill the same half of the empty orange (the half that does not contain the die cut star) with olive oil. Slowly and carefully fill the half only ¼ to ½ way. Do not cover the top of the orange wick. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Clementine-Candle-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Light the wick with a match and hold for several seconds until the fire “takes.” Place the star cut top half of the orange on top of the lit half for a unique and alluring “candle.”
